results.title: Collingwood
results.brief_description: A historical look at Collingwood which shows and discusses early settlement, farming, brewing, some manufacturing and retail activities. Includes two interviews - one with a former factory worker and one with a shoe factory worker.

results.title: Transport in plants and animals: capture of nutrients in plants and animals
results.creator_credit: Shane Mulcahy, Glen Foster and Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: 1. “Transport in plants and animals”. Explains how plants and animals transport their nutritional requirements internally. Similarities and differences between the transport methods are discussed. 2. “Capture of nutrients in plants and animals”. Every living organism needs a method of taking nutrients and of spelling waste products. This program examines which nutrients are esential to plants and animals and compares the system used to achieve this exchange of substances.

results.title: Village on the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: State Historian, Dr. Bernard Barrett talks about early Melbourne, the first landing parties in the Melbourne areas and the events leading up to its establishment on the banks of the Yarra.

results.title: Skinsense
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: A general discussion on attaining and mantaining normal healthy skin. Includes haircare and shampoos, nailcare and general skincare, moisturisers, soaps, cosmetics and deodorants. The effects of sunshine on skin and protective behaviour are also covered.

results.title: Dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: Peter Bence, Steve Skok and Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed, Schools Div, Victoria
results.brief_description: Fossil records show that the dinosaurs were an enormously successful group containing many species. This program examines the reasons why they were so prolific and discusses some of the theories behind their disappearance.

results.title: Esty Deez
results.creator_credit: Tom McPartland, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A frank look at the importance of using condoms to prevent sexually transmited diseases. Discusses the dangers of having multiple sexual partners and what should be done if an STD is contracted. Depicts the behaviour of adolescents together with contemporary language to ensure the attention of the intended audience. NB: TEACHER PREVIEW PRIOR TO CLASSROOM VIEWING IS RECOMMENDED.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom McPartland, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health

results.title: STD's . . . Not just long distance phone calls
results.creator_credit: Wendy Thompson, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the ways in which sexually transmitted diseases are transmitted and how they can (mostly) be cured. Looks at what happens at an STD clinic and encourages the use of condoms to prevent STDs.

results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.
